revised_title: A Study of Sensitized Explosions: Hydrogen Oxygen Reaction Catalyzed by Nitrogen Peroxide
tldr: The authors studied the catalysis of the combustion of hydrogen and oxygen by nitrogen peroxide and found that the slow reaction and explosive reaction both have an induction period. The ignition point of the mixture is affected by factors such as light, internal surface, inert gases, and small quantities of methane. The results provide a more complete understanding of the catalytic effect of nitrogen peroxide.
